Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2013 04:51PM patsback wrote: Found a lump on June 1st. Went for a mammogram on June 4th, had ultrasound and biopsy on June 5th.  On June 6th, I got the call that it was malignant.  Had the lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy on June 25th and on July 2nd was told I need a mastectomy.  I meet with the plastic surgeon on the 15th and on the 18th I see my surgeon (for the first time since the lumpectomy - she was on vacation on July 2nd).  I'm assuming I'll get the date for my mastectomy on the 18th.  Any ideas on what to expect?
Posts.Title: Hello Everyone Waiting, Waiting and Waiting sadie1015 patsback

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2013 06:00AM - edited Aug 5, 2013 08:31AM by patsback I was diagnosed on June 6th, had a lumpectomy and sentinal node biopsy on June 25th.  I am now scheduled to have a mastectomy and axillary lymph node dissection tomorrow.  I'm okay with the surgery, it's the drains afterwards that I'm freaked out about...not to mention the chemo and radiation treatments afterwards.   I just wanted to say that, in my eyes, you are all strong women, and reading these posts have given me some comfort in easing some of my questions. Good luck to all of you.
Posts.Title: August 2013 Surgeries laura11103 babs6287

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2013 07:45PM patsback wrote: My surgery was on August 6th.  I'm off pain medication completely.  I'm not sure when they will begin chemo.. I meet with the medical on oncologist on Tuesday.  PET/CT given Wednesday shows spot (I think that was dr.'s word) in bone by pelvic area and lower lumbar/spine.  It's got me worried a bit, but I'm trying not to dwell on it now.   For those who have had their surgery, is it common to have a nagging "burning" sensation where the breast was?  It's not painful, just annoying.
Posts.Title: August 2013 Surgeries laura11103 babs6287

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2013 05:18PM patsback wrote: I found out this June that I had breast cancer. In August, after my mastectomy and a PET/CT, I was informed it was Stave IV, with mets to bone
